name: JRTest.AllergyIntolerance
purpose: Test of the logical model module

element.label: JRTest.AllergyIntolerance
element.definition: No description

element.label: identifier
element.short: External ids for this item
element.definition: This records identifiers associated with this allergy/intolerance concern that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

element.label: clinicalStatus
element.short: active | inactive | resolved
element.definition: The clinical status of the allergy or intolerance.

element.label: verificationStatus
element.short: unconfirmed | confirmed | refuted | entered-in-error
element.definition: Assertion about certainty associated with the propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance (including pharmaceutical product).

element.label: type
element.short: allergy | intolerance - Underlying mechanism (if known)
element.definition: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for the reaction risk.

element.label: category
element.short: food | medication | environment | biologic
element.definition: Category of the identified substance.

element.label: criticality
element.short: low | high | unable-to-assess
element.definition: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of the reaction to the identified substance.

element.label: code
element.short: Code that identifies the allergy or intolerance
element.definition: Code for an allergy or intolerance statement (either a positive or a negated/excluded statement).  This may be a code for a substance or pharmaceutical product that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction risk (e.g., "Latex"), an allergy or intolerance condition (e.g., "Latex allergy"), or a negated/excluded code for a specific substance or class (e.g., "No latex allergy") or a general or categorical negated statement (e.g.,  "No known allergy", "No known drug allergies").

element.label: patient
element.short: Who the sensitivity is for
element.definition: The patient who has the allergy or intolerance.

element.label: onset[x]
element.short: When allergy or intolerance was identified
element.definition: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

element.label: assertedDate
element.short: Date record was believed accurate
element.definition: The date on which the existance of the AllergyIntolerance was first asserted or acknowledged.

element.label: recorder
element.short: Who recorded the sensitivity
element.definition: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

element.label: asserter
element.short: Source of the information about the allergy
element.definition: The source of the information about the allergy that is recorded.

element.label: lastOccurrence
element.short: Date(/time) of last known occurrence of a reaction
element.definition: Represents the date and/or time of the last known occurrence of a reaction event.

element.label: note
element.short: Additional text not captured in other fields
element.definition: Additional narrative about the propensity for the Adverse Reaction, not captured in other fields.

element.label: reaction
element.short: Adverse Reaction Events linked to exposure to substance
element.definition: Details about each adverse reaction event linked to exposure to the identified substance.

element.label: substance
element.short: Specific substance or pharmaceutical product considered to be responsible for event
element.definition: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.

element.label: manifestation
element.short: Clinical symptoms/signs associated with the Event
element.definition: Clinical symptoms and/or signs that are observed or associated with the adverse reaction event.

element.label: description
element.short: Description of the event as a whole
element.definition: Text description about the reaction as a whole, including details of the manifestation if required.

element.label: onset
element.short: Date(/time) when manifestations showed
element.definition: Record of the date and/or time of the onset of the Reaction.

element.label: severity
element.short: mild | moderate | severe (of event as a whole)
element.definition: Clinical assessment of the severity of the reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.

element.label: exposureRoute
element.short: How the subject was exposed to the substance
element.definition: Identification of the route by which the subject was exposed to the substance.

element.label: note
element.short: Text about event not captured in other fields
element.definition: Additional text about the adverse reaction event not captured in other fields.
